item.title: Report X-2024061579
item.description:
Report X-2024061579

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The box came off the trailer dry, but you could tell the cardboard had been wet. The box was put into a red hazmat bin. when I came in to work to look at the hazmat, I saw the box was dry, but inside the cap to one of the glass 4-liter containers was loose and 2 liters of the liquid was out of the glass liter container. I tightened the lid and checked all the other lids to make sure they were all tight.

item.title: Report X-2024061578
item.description:
Report X-2024061578

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: PALMDALE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered during the morning sort and was brought to QA from Unload in a red container wrapped in a plastic bag. Box was inspected to be soiled at the top and corner of the package where 2 bottles appear to be missing some contents. Package appeared to have had a heavy weight on top which allowed for leakage of contents through the caps. The box also appears to have been crushed towards the bottom or dropped from a considerable height. Improper handling of package.

item.title: Report X-2024061595
item.description:
Report X-2024061595

  • City: SACRAMENTO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM THE OVERHEAD SORTER TORN OPEN AND WET. NO MARKINGS INDICATING SHIPPING STATUS OF GOODS. SPIDR INDICATES THAT PACKAGE WAS INITIALLY DAMAGED AT RLTO OVERHEAD SORTER, DAMAGES EXACERBATED AS PACKAGE WAS INDUCTED INTO SACR OVERHEAD SORTER. ONE AEROSOL CAN WITH ONE INCH CUT ABOVE THE BASE. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2024060608
item.description:
Report E-2024060608

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UAD experienced a UN1263 RDL39LVOC1 BF USA release from a 44.40-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 30 x 4 area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a puncture caused by the trailer wall. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2024061426

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS 4 X 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF DEGREASER H.D. HEAVY DUTY CONCENTRATE ONE 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP ALLOWING .25 GALLONS TO RELEASE PACKAGE DID HAVE SLOTTED PARTITIONS BUT NO BAGS OR ABSORBENT WAS FOUND. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION. PACKAGE HANDLER #2972155 DILLON FISHER WAS INJURYED BY PACKAGE DILLION PICKED UP THE PACKAGE AS IT CAME DOWN THE IC BELT NOT KNOWING THAT IT WAS A WET LEAKING HAZMAT GETTING THE LIQUID ON HIS HANDS.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE MARKED PROPERLY, DIAMOND LABEL CORROSIVE 8- UN3264 CORROSIVE LIQUID, ACIDIC, INORGANIC, N.O.S. (SULFAMIC ACID). CONTENTS WAS 4-1 GALLONS OF ZEP(CALCIUM LIME RUST STAIN REMOVER). THE BOTTLES CAPS WERE LOOSE CAUSING LEAKAGE. THE CAPS WERE TIGHTENED ON ALL 4 BOTTLES. THEN WERE PLACED IN GREEN DMP BAG WITH WET CARDBOARD NAPKINS 5 INCHES OF ZEP ZORBENT AND SODIUM BICARBONATE TO NEUTRALIZE SPILL TO PH RANGE 6-9. AWAITING FURTHER INSTRUCTION FOR DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024061094
item.description:
Report X-2024061094

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: LEWISTON
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was discovered wet upon opening the trailer at the beginning of the pre-load sort at around 2:30am according to the OPS Supervisors on duty. Package was then placed into red line hazmat bin & brought to QA for inspection. When the package was discovered by QA, the box was soaked/stained on one side & ripped open. The fiberboard box also had several class 8 corrosive markings, UN/USA markings, & hazmat shipping paperwork attached to it. 4 bottles of Nu-Brite Condenser Coil Cleaner were found inside the box w/ 2 each separated by a fiberboard liner. 2 of the bottle's caps had been crushed/bent downward into the body & the 3rd was crushed/bent/squeezed on its body in the middle on each side, causing the contents to leak through the caps. 3 of the bottles were dented on several areas as well. During the inspection process an additional red line hazmat bin was used to inspect the box & contents. A long green rubber glove & several biodegradable single use nitrile gloves were used to handle the corrosive substance. The Improper Shipping Form & Damaged Package Report were filled out & all of the Contents, fiberboard box, & PPE were placed into a lined salvage drum.

item.description:
Report X-2024061059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat UN1139 was unloaded in the small unload and van scanned to WA 271 at 6:21AM. The package wasn't noticed to be wet or leaking until the driver inspected the package on his vehicle. Upon the driver's coding, Quality Assurance was immediately notified of the wet package placed in plastic bags to contain the spill. Upon external inspection, The package was wet, had a strong odor, and labels were faded from the liquid. After the tracking number was identified, the internal inspection began. 1 gallon of coval ultimate top coat gloss was leaking due from pressure on the cap and 1 quart of the flammable liquid coating solution leaked out. 3 quarts still remain intact in the 1 gallon plastic bottle. The fiberboard box, plastic bottle containing the coating solution, and the plastic bags were placed securely in a hazardous materials bag and then inside a salvage drum. There was no inner packing materials to lessen the pressure on the cap of the coating solution to prevent the lid from loosening.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 17, 2024, one (1) 35-gallon pail of UN1789 was punctured and released approximately 29-gallons of product to the trailer floor, adjacent cargo, and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon OP. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site and containerized all impacted material in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal. On June 18, 2024, FCE returned to continue remediation. Crews removed the impacted wooden pallets and packaging materials. All impacted debris was containerized as waste in two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite for disposal. On June 20, 2024, FCE returned to the site to further over pack the affected cargo of four (4) 55-gallon fiber drums. Crews collected and containerized the four (4) fiber drums into four (4) 95-gallon over pack poly drums and staged them onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060612
item.description:
Report E-2024060612

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 17, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1814 was punctured while loading and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. The damaged tote was transferred into a new 330-gallon tote. The empty, damaged tote was removed for disposal. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal. On June 20, 2024, R+L requested crews return to the site to address lingering odors inside the trailer and excess dried product that remained on interior and exterior surfaces of the trailer. CES dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to assess and remediate. AOTC arrived and scraped excess material from the inside and outside trailer surfaces then wiped down surfaces with hot water and cleaning/neutralizing solution. All waste material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061473
item.description:
Report X-2024061473

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=275942772492 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Unloading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=3480 CLASS=90 PSN TEXT=Lithium Ion Batteries PKG GRP=N/A SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=500 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Milliliter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=D - Fiberboard or cardboard NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=3 - Box TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=2 TOTAL UOM=Solid - Kilogram TECH NAME=Section IB )On 6/16/2024 at approximately 1950, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 906768 at the ramp facility in Denver, reporting and undeclared dangeorus goods spill. The shipment consisted of three glass bottles of hydrochloric acid and lithium battery powerbank. Two of the bottles spilled in transit, one of the bottles appeared to have shattered and the other leaked. The battery was illegally packaged with these commodities and the entire shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as the package was did not have the required markings, labeling, packaging, or paperwork. The spillage also affected an additional non-DG package. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.description:
Report E-2024060630

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21 , 2024, at 0946 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of Isopropyl Alcohol. It was reported terminal personnel discovered a release of approximately 1 cup of Isopropyl Alcohol (UN1219, 3, II) from (1) 55-gallon DM due to being punctured. The release impacted the side of the drum only. Terminal personnel were able to patch the puncture to the drum, then placed the damaged drum into a 95-gallon overpack DF. Terminal personnel then cleaned the release with the appropriate PPE.

item.description:
Report E-2024060626

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was operating a forklift with a drum grabber attachment to load drums into a trailer. During this process, the employee observed an odor. The employee stopped operating the forklift and went to investigate the source of the odor. Further investigation revealed that a drum in the trailer was leaking from a small pin sized puncture in the middle of its body. Approximately one pint of the liquid chemical had leaked from the drum and released onto the trailer floor. The duration of the spill was less than 5 minutes. The employee removed the leaking drum from the trailer and placed it into a salvage drum with absorbent. The spill was cleaned up by two other Veolia employees that were on the premises.

  • City: PERRYSBURG

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted three (3) metal pails and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due one (1) damaged 5-gallon metal pail. First Call Environmental personnel containerized the damaged pail and the three (3) impacted pails into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

The spill is contained and no one will be there over the weekend.

item.description:
Report E-2024060581

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21, 2024, at 0911 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of Zep Zepresto. It was reported that the terminal personnel discovered a release of a total of 1 cup of ZEP ZEPRESTO (UN2922, Corrosive liquids, toxic. n.o.s. (Cresylic Acid Methylene Chloride), 8, 6.1, II) from (2) 20-gallon DMs due to improper packaging. The release impacted shrink wrap and a pallet. Terminal personnel were able to patch the puncture to the drums, then placed the damaged drums into a 95-gallon overpack DF. Terminal personnel then cleaned the release with the appropriate PPE.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 17, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and adjacent cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged pail in one (1) 30-gallon drum. LSH personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • City: DALLAS

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 14, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3264 was punctured and released approximately thirty-five (35) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH deployed absorbents to the impacted trailer and concrete surfaces. All impacted absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite for disposal. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 14, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN1789 fell in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, debris, and the damaged container were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED WHILE STILL IN A SMALLS BAG FROM THE UNLOAD AND SENT TO THE SMALL SORT. THE DEBAGGER NOTICED THAT IT WAS WET FROM THE INSIDE OUT. HE LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER THEN PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A DMP GREEN BAG. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING, IT WAS THEN DETERMINED TO BE AN UNDECLARED PACKAGE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER: 1ZC1G375YW31120956

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-10
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 15-gallons of UN3082 "Moccasin II Plus" was released from one (1) 275-gallon tote impacting the trailer floor at the dock door. The caller advised they placed the tote on its side to stop the leak. The tote was punctured by a loading strap in transit. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and dispatched Clean Harbors to assist with clean up. Clean Harbors arrived on site and transferred the remaining material from the damaged tote into a new tote. Clean Harbors deployed oil dri and cleaned the impacted area. The spent oil dri and recovered material was placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums for disposal.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0

  • Description: 4-1gal plastic bottles of JD aluminum stainless steel cleaner concentrate in box. Cap loose on 1 bottle spilling several fl oz of liquid into the box. Box marked as Class8 hazmat with directional arrows. Box found leaking during preload sort and placed sideways into red hazmat bin.

item.title: Report E-2024060530
item.description:
Report E-2024060530

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNA experienced a release from a 220-gallon metal tote. The tote was shipped as empty with residual material in it. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 1 x 6 area of the concrete dock due to a loose valve. The contractors tightened the valve which was re-secured for shipment on. The impacted cardboard and rags were collected into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 14, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN3378 was torn while loading and released approximately fifteen (15) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the UN3264-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly vented drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

  • Description: On June 13th during the PM sort a cooler was discovered leaking with the words "Sulfuric Acid" on some documents on top of the cooler. Further inspection showed 2 bottles inside labeled as sulfuric acid, and 2 other bags with what is suspected to be water. It is unclear if the spilled liquid is the acid or water or a combination of the two. The package was placed into a salvage drum and is being held pending disposition.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from three (3) 5-gallon plastic pails. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the spent absorbents and damaged pails into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2024060892

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHITNEY JOHNSON, 004 OPERATIONS SUPERVISOR, ADVISED SAFETY OF A UN1262, OCTANES SPILL ON THE DOCK FLOOR. WHITNEY STATED LEON VANCE, FORKLIFT OPERATOR, PICKED UP THE SKID TO MOVED IT AND NOTICED IT LEAKING. WHITNEY ADVISED SHE BELIEVES LEON PUNCTURED THE DRUM BUT WASN'T POSITIVE IF HE DID. WHITNEY S TATED LEON THEN PLACED IT IN A TRASH CAN 50 GALLON BARREL WITH TRASH. WHITNEY ADVISED THEY THEN GOT THE DRUM OUT OF THE TRASH CAN AND PLACED WITH THE PUNCTURE RIGHT SIDE UP AND PLACED EPOXY OVER THE HOLE. WHTNEY STATED THE SPILL, 8 FL OZ OF OCTANE EVAPORATED ON THE DOCK FLOOR.~~SAFETY ADVISED WHITNE Y TO PLACE THE TRASH BAG IN THE HAZMAT RECOVERY BIN. SAFETY ALSO ADVISED WHITNEY TO REMIND LEON TO CONTACT SAFETY IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING A HAZMAT SPILL AND DO NOT TOUCH THE SPILL. CURA SHOULD ALWAYS BE CONTACTED FOR A HAZMAT SPILL.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2-gallons of Sodium Hydroxide Solution (UN1824) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor at door #17. ERTS advised contractor HEPACO would respond due to the corrosive state of the product and amount released. HEPACO advised Oil Dri was applied to the impacted area and the concrete dock was neutralized with a muriatic acid solution. The damaged drum was then placed into a 95-gallon poly drum and the impacted absorbents, pads and PPE were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum for disposal. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH

  • Description: On June 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of corrosive liquid had a faulty seam and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted areas and placed the damaged drum into a 95-gallon over-pack for disposal. TLE personnel applied granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and asphalt surface and worked them in with hand tools. All corrosive liquid impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 95-gallon drum and one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024060478

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-25T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 7, 2024, fifty (50) 1-gallon jugs of UN3266 were damaged in a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3266-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All damaged jugs, spent absorbents and absorbent pads were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal. Majority of the jugs only needed their lid tightened and were placed into a CYB for future processing.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-25T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, 25-gallons of Ultrasil 76 was released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC was dispatched to assist with clean up. Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC deployed oil dri and sodium bicarbonate to neutralize the spill. The released product, damaged drum, and oil-dri was placed into an 85-gallon poly drum and 55-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

  • Description: AT THE UPS MIAMI FLORIDA FACILITY, NINE SKIDS MOVING TO COLOMBIA VIA UPS AIR CARGO SERVICE WERE FOUND CONTAINING BOXES WITH COVERED LITHIUM BATTERY MARKS. ALL NINE SKIDS ARE BLACK SHRINK WRAPPED WITHOUT ANY DANGEROUS GOODS INDICATORS ON THE OUTER COVERING. A TOTAL OF 23 BOXES EACH CONTAINING 72 WIRELESS LITHIUM-ION BATTERY POWERED MYJOY COOL EARBUDS WERE FOUND. DURING FORKLIFT MOVEMENT OF THE SKIDS, WE CAN SEE LITHIUM BATTERY MARKS UNDERNEATH ON THE VERY BOTTOM OF THE FREIGHT. THE AIR WAYBILL DOES NOT INDICATE LITHIUM BATTERIES ARE BEING SHIPPED TO COLOMBIA. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY PART OF THE OUTER BLACK SHRINK WRAPPED FREIGHT. EHMA EXPRESS INC, 8509 NW 68TH ST, MIAMI FL 33166 IS THE ISSUING CARRIER'S AGENCY ON THE AIR WAYBILL. SHIPPER'S NAME AND ADDRESS IS SUNRISE FINANCIAL BUSINESS, S.A. C/O FIFO WIRELESS, INC, 10900 NW 21ST STREET SUITE 210, MIAMI FL 33172.

item.title: Report E-2024060431
item.description:
Report E-2024060431

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-15
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SET Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and 5ft-by-14ft area of the asphalt lot and estimated that eight (8) gallons of material was released due to load shift that crushed four boxes containing eight (8) 1-gallon plastic jugs. SET Environmental personnel deployed a neutralizer and then a granular absorbent to the impacted areas. The spent material was gathered and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and the damaged plastic jugs were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USU experienced a UN1760 Captain XTR release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1 x 1 area of the concrete dock floor due to being crushed by boxes of the same material stacked on top of it. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted areas were then wiped clean. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 13, 2024, one (1) 70-pound battery was punctured and released approximately 1.5-gallons od battery acid to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged batteries were placed into one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 11, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1760 had a faulty valve and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Resolute Environmental & Response Services, LLC (RERS) to remediate the site. RERS closed the valve preventing any further leakage. RERS then wiped down all totes and deployed soda ash to the affected areas and swept them in using hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060436
item.description:
Report E-2024060436

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 11, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon pails of UN3264 were crushed in transit and released approximately 2.5-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER discovered that R+L personnel had placed four damaged drums into one (1) 15-gallon drum. ER personnel utilized a neutralizing agent to remediate the trailer. Granular absorbents were then placed on the impacted areas and swept using hand tools. ER then broke down the impacted pallet completing remediation. All spent absorbents as well as the pallet were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

The driver notified Veolia management personnel and applied oil dry to the material that released to the ground. Veolia employees investigated the spill and discovered the container had tipped over while in transportation and leaked from the drum closure. The spill was remediated, the drum was closed properly and the load was properly secured for continued transportation without any further incident.

item.title: Report X-2024061194
item.description:
Report X-2024061194

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-27
  • City: MACON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: NS personnel inside Brosnan Yard (Macon, GA) reported a Chlorine release from an unidentified car. A personnel reported a strong smell of Chlorine while walking the line of tank cars. Upon inspection by a contractor, it was noted that tank car OLNX 711120 was the car that was leaking. A strong smell of chlorine was noted, audible hissing was found, degradation to the paint in the protective housing was noted. The source of the leak was found to be the Tell-Tale valve on the PRD. The valve was open. The tell-tale valve was closed and the leak stopped. The tell-tale valve leaking also indicates the rupture disc under the PRD was not intact.
